data.description: About Us: Barry-Wehmiller is a diversified global supplier of engineering consulting and manufacturing technology for the packaging, corrugating, sheeting and paper-converting industries. By blending people-centric leadership with disciplined operational strategies and purpose-driven growth, Barry-Wehmiller has become a $3 billion organization with nearly 12,000 team members united by a common belief: to use the power of business to build a better world. Job Description:Barry-Wehmiller Companies, Inc. (http://www.barry-wehmiller.com) is a diversified global supplier of manufacturing technology and services across a broad spectrum of industries. Through our vision of “Achieving Principled Results on Purpose,” we remain committed to the creation of a business legacy that blends our unique focus on people-centric leadership with disciplined operational strategies and purpose-driven growth. This strategy has sustained a healthy pattern of nearly 20 percent compound annual growth for more than 30 years and has helped transform Barry-Wehmiller into a well-balanced and financially solid company with revenues surpassing $3.0 billion and more than 12,000 team members around the world. The Business Insights Developer & Analyst Intern translates data into meaningful and actionable insights for business partners. Analysis performed will directly impact and influence strategic decision making across our organization.  The person selected will experiment with and utilize the latest technologies in Business Intelligence, Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence to create reporting and analytics solutions from disparate data sources to spot meaningful trends and patterns. Findings may be communicated through dashboards, graphs, charts etc.  This position works closely with business teams and reporting partners in support of business decision support and product management. This role will be part of a collaborative, purposeful and passionate team in the manufacturing industry, operating with agility and leveraging modern architecture, tools & processes.Responsibilities include:Create data and reports to identify trends/insights that will influence business decisions. Analyses supported include product analytics, channel analytics, financial analytics, customer behavior analytics, marketing analytics, etc.Create presentations, graphs or dashboards to display results of reportsExperiment with and leverage AI technologies to aid in decision making, problem solving, and simplifying the user experienceUse deductive and inductive research approaches to support decision makingAssist in communicating findings to business in a concise and understandable fashionCreate presentations, graphs, dashboards, etc. to display findings and results utilizing Excel, PowerBi, PowerPoint, etc.Work with the business to identify metrics to be tracked, including key performance indicators, client segments, etc.Assist in translating business stakeholder requirements into reporting deliverables for the reporting team to automateDevelop trusted partnerships with business leaders based on collaboration and knowledge of businessHelp the business identify and formulate hypotheses (deductive)Monitor data and identify patterns and trends (inductive)Requirements and Qualifications:Working on a degree in IT, business analytics, engineering, mathematics, statistics, computer science or related degrees. Degrees outside of this area may be considered if the candidate has integrated data and analytics methods within that degree and is interested in further pursing data analytics related careers.Some knowledge of SQL and Microsoft Applications, including Excel and Power QueryKnowledge of Tableau, Power BI, or other business intelligence softwareAbility to develop datasets to support advanced analytics and reportingExperience with AI technologies and LLM/natural language models is a plusUnderstanding and ability to conduct data extractionInterest in improving processes an creating efficienciesDemonstrates curiosity about what drives business trends and customer behaviorsMust be comfortable with constantly evolving environment and rapidly changing prioritiesMust be Business-Centric, Data-Oriented, Analytically Minded and Results DrivenUnderstanding of standard product metrics such as conversion rates, response rates, ROI, etc.Ability to identify appropriate datasets to be able to support analyticsAttention to detail and accuracySolid critical thinking skills to scope and frame problemsDisplays excellent judgment to understand and support business needsMust be able to effectively plan and manage responsibilitiesEffective communication skills to manage expectations and challengesEffective interpersonal and relationship building skills to effectively work with teammates and business partners#LI-AL1 At Barry-Wehmiller we recognize that people come with a wealth of experience and talent beyond just the technical requirements of a job.  If your experience is close to what you see listed here, please still consider applying.  We know that our differences often can bring about innovation, excellence and meaningful work—therefore, people from all backgrounds are encouraged to apply to our positions.  Please let us know if you require reasonable accommodations during the interview process. ​Barry-Wehmiller is an equal opportunity employer. M/F/D/V This organization uses E-Verify. Applicants may be subject to pre-employment screening which may include drug screening, reference checks, employment verifications, background screening and/or skills assessments. Company:BW Corporate US
requirements: Assist in translating business stakeholder requirements into reporting deliverables for the reporting team to automate

Working on a degree in IT, business analytics, engineering, mathematics, statistics, computer science or related degrees. Degrees outside of this area may be considered if the candidate has integrated data and analytics methods within that degree and is interested in further pursing data analytics related careers.
responsibilities: Create data and reports to identify trends/insights that will influence business decisions. Analyses supported include product analytics, channel analytics, financial analytics, customer behavior analytics, marketing analytics, etc.
Develop trusted partnerships with business leaders based on collaboration and knowledge of business
Ability to develop datasets to support advanced analytics and reporting
Must be able to effectively plan and manage responsibilities
